fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article that detailed a variety of theories on how parakeets were introduced into the wild in the UK said one explanation was that birds kept at Syon Park in west London in the 1970s escaped when a plane crashed through the aviary roof. That should have said debris from a plane, not a plane itself (Fears of being sick as a parrot may have led to parakeet releases, 12 December, page 17). • Other recently corrected articles include: Winter weekenders: 15 picturesque UK towns for a pre-Christmas break Trump’s latest attack on Greta Thunberg was sexist, ableist – and perhaps jealous Couple jailed for murdering woman and claiming her benefits Barrie Keeffe obituary
